description: This example shows how to create or update an account resource.

properties.jobId: System generated globally unique id for the job. This property is read only.

instanceTypes.instanceType: The instance type belonging to the same series.

placementPolicies.location: An optional location for instance type placement. If specified, this must be one of the account resource locations.

dataLocation.storageCacheContainerName: Name of the managed storage resource to mount.

codeLocation.storageCacheContainerName: Name of the managed storage resource to mount.

outputLocation.storageCacheContainerName: Name of the managed storage resource to mount.

networkResourceRef.name: Name of the network resource to reference.

properties.groupPolicyName: Group policy name associated with the training job.

checkpointPolicy.checkpointRelativePath: The relative path in the platform storage.
checkpointPolicy.checkpointInterval: Maximum elapsed duration between subsequent checkpoints. The value should be in ISO  8601 format (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations).

checkpointRetentionPolicy.ttl: Minimum elapsed duration before deleting checkpoint. The value should be in ISO  8601 format (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations).

properties.program: The entry script for your Job in the codeLocation. For interactive jobs, specify null.
properties.programArgs: Command line arguments to be passed to the program.
properties.tensorBoardLogDirectory: The directory which TensorBoard will be configured to use as the log directory.
properties.statusDetails: Gives additional information about the current status of the job.
properties.notebookEndpoint: Url to access Jupyter notebook endpoint of the job.
properties.tensorBoardEndpoint: Url to access TensorBoard endpoint of the job.
properties.grafanaEndpoint: Url to access Grafana endpoint of the job.
properties.jobLogsEndpoint: Url to access logs of the job.
